Articles.Content:
Does it exist already?

I found the [Graphotron 2000](http://www.kerbaltek.com/graphotron) Mod, but it seems to be able to plot against time only.

I would like to see a graph with Altitude on the y-axis and horizontal distance on the x-axis. Like in the [video](http://www.esa.int/spaceinvideos/Videos/2015/06/Sentinel-2A_launch_full_replay) of the Sentinel-2A launch (at 18:20).

Would be nice if it also showed the times at which stage separation occured, something like this:

![profile1.png](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-cXXbgL_qyhA/UFZKyHcgJNI/AAAAAAAADnI/agbA9lnfTF4/s1360/profile1.png)

Im not sure if it plots it on horizontal distance, but [Telemachus](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24594-1-0-2-%282015-06-10%29-Telemachus-%E2%80%93-Telemetry-and-Flight-Control-in-the-Web-Browser) would be your best bet.

RasterPropMonitor also has an altitude graph, but that is definitely plotted against time.

You also might try VOID. It has a data logging function which, when you hit start, logs to a CSV file which can be opened with a spreadsheet. 

From there you can graph anything versus anything. 

You have to graph outside of game after you stop logging as it won't graph in game.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/54533](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/54533)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-24T16:36:24Z" title="06/24/2015 04:36  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 24, 2015</time> by dorin6565**
